entry.title: In Freundschaft (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that In Freundschaft was composed in friendship by Karlheinz Stockhausen as a clarinet solo for Suzanne Stephens (pictured), and later adapted to the instruments of other friends?

entry.title: Zeb Noland (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Zeb Noland was named the starting quarterback for the South Carolina Gamecocks despite being on the coaching staff?

entry.title: A Passage North (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that A Passage North, which is shortlisted for the 2021 Booker Prize, is set in the aftermath of the Sri Lankan Civil War?

entry.title: Eberhard Panitz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Eberhard Panitz wrote his novel, My Father's Tram, with autobiographic elements around his father—a tram conductor in Dresden?

entry.title: HiNote Ultra (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Digital pulled their HiNote Ultra laptop out of a manila envelope on television nearly 15 years before Apple did the same?

entry.title: Carl Freedman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Carl Freedman viewed science fiction as the most sound genre for academic study?

entry.title: Dipteronia brownii (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that pollen study was needed to clarify the identity of a Dipteronia brownii fossil?

entry.title: Bryant Park Studios (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a tenant of the Bryant Park Studios once tried to evict their landlord from the building's top floor?
